content.content: Hi! I hope this is not off-topic Is there a good explanation of the function and structure of MakerDAO? I’m looking for inspiration to build a modular DAO, and I was recommended to look into the structure of MakerDAO. Specifically, I would like to know about the structure and formation of sub-DAOs as well as associated legal entities Anything is helpful Thanks!
content.GPT-summary: The post is a question from a third party asking for an explanation of the function and structure of MakerDAO. The third party is looking for inspiration to build a modular DAO and is interested in the structure and formation of sub-DAOs as well as associated legal entities. The post is not an advertisement, and there is no feedback or criticism of the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Sub-DAOs do not exist yet. There are variety of forum posts like this explaining various planned aspects. Right now, MakerDAO relies primarily on core units. Core units propose budgets to the DAO, along with a commitment to do various work. They generally have their own legal entities that manages internal payroll and expenses. For more general governance information, you can check the MIPs and voting portal.    MIPs Portal    MIPs Portal Maker Improvement Proposals are the preferred mechanism for improving both Maker Governance and the Maker Protocol.        vote.makerdao.com   Governance Portal The MakerDAO Governance Portal allows for anyone to view governance proposals, and also allows for MKR holders to vote.
